@graph.caption: Roasted tomatillo salsa. Chunky, rustic, spicy, and tangy.

@graph.name: Roasted Tomatillo Salsa « Dora's Table
@graph.description: This recipe for roasted tomatillo salsa is rustic, spicy, tangy, and perfect for tacos, dipping in chips, or eating with by the spoonful.

@graph.name: Dora S.
@graph.description: Dora is the founder, recipe developer, and photographer at Dora's Table and Mi Mero Mole. Born and raised in Mexico and a graduate of the Culinary Institute of America in New York, she adopted a vegan (plant-based) diet to take control of her health.

@graph.name: Roasted Tomatillo Salsa
@graph.description: Broil or roast the ingredients and mash them up for a smokey, authentic salsa.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat a comal, cast-iron, or heavy bottomed pan to medium-high heat. Place the tomatillos, garlic, onion, and Serrano peppers directly on the hot pan. They will become soft and slightly blackened, about 7 – 10 min.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat a comal, cast-iron, or heavy bottomed pan to medium-high heat. Place the tomatillos, garlic, onion, and Serrano peppers directly on the hot pan. They will become soft and slightly blackened, about 7 – 10 min.

recipeInstructions.text: Flip tomatillos, peppers, onion, and garlic over and continue to char for 10 more minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Flip tomatillos, peppers, onion, and garlic over and continue to char for 10 more minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove ingredients from griddle and set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove ingredients from griddle and set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Start grinding ingredients in molcajete one at a time. Once the desired consistency is reached, add the next ingredient and keep grinding. Season with salt and pepper and serve.
recipeInstructions.name: Start grinding ingredients in molcajete one at a time. Once the desired consistency is reached, add the next ingredient and keep grinding. Season with salt and pepper and serve.

recipeInstructions.text: If you do not have a molcajete you can use a blender or food processor. Simply place all the cooked ingredients in the machine and pulse until the desired consistency is reached.
recipeInstructions.name: If you do not have a molcajete you can use a blender or food processor. Simply place all the cooked ingredients in the machine and pulse until the desired consistency is reached.
